meanings.definition: A person who stockpiles goods or materials for future use.
meanings.sent1: The stockpiler had shelves full of canned food in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a stockpiler who always has extra supplies in their garage.
meanings.sent3: The stockpiler joked that they were preparing for the apocalypse, but really just liked to be prepared.
meanings.sent4: She was a stockpiler of books, filling every corner of her house with novels and nonfiction.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stockpiler surrounded by their hoard of supplies was both impressive and slightly overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To accumulate a large supply of goods or materials for future use.
meanings.sent1: I tend to stockpiler non-perishable items whenever they go on sale at the store.
meanings.sent2: During times of uncertainty, people often stockpiler essential items like toilet paper and canned goods.
meanings.sent3: He decided to stockpiler building materials for his DIY projects, just in case prices went up.
meanings.sent4: The company chose to stockpiler raw materials to avoid any potential shortages in the future.
meanings.sent5: She would stockpiler fabric whenever she found a good deal, creating a colorful stash for future sewing projects.
